title: Drawing, "Study for Painting:  Mount Olympus", 1750–60
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, white gouache on cream laid paper
inscribed: On verso in pen and brown ink: "Vito d'Anna"
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Hermes flying alongside Bacchus and an unidentified goddess seated in the clouds.  Apollo and a muse, who holds a plumb-level, are seated on the row of clouds beneath them. Hercules is visible in the distance. Several putti are scattered amongst the gods in the clouds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for Painting:  Mount Olympus", 1750–60.
1750–60. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, white gouache on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7331.
